formattedAddress: 77 Delancey St, New York, NY 10002, USA
adrFormatAddress: 77 Delancey St, New York, NY 10002, USA

originalText.text: You just can’t beat $1 oysters for happy hour!! The presentation is great (3 sauce options & lemon on ice) and the oysters were wonderful. Decent size, fresh and delicious! The Bloody Mary was yummy too. A very casual, comfortable atmosphere. The service was excellent!! Will be back.

text.text: You just can’t beat $1 oysters for happy hour!! The presentation is great (3 sauce options & lemon on ice) and the oysters were wonderful. Decent size, fresh and delicious! The Bloody Mary was yummy too. A very casual, comfortable atmosphere. The service was excellent!! Will be back.

originalText.text: A great place. The atmosphere is just what you would expect in lower East Side. Standing in line at Double Chicken please doesn’t make sense. The cocktails at The Oyster Bar are excellent, especially the Espresso Martini. A knock out. Don’t forget the oysters: they are delicious.

text.text: A great place. The atmosphere is just what you would expect in lower East Side. Standing in line at Double Chicken please doesn’t make sense. The cocktails at The Oyster Bar are excellent, especially the Espresso Martini. A knock out. Don’t forget the oysters: they are delicious.

originalText.text: It is also called the Grey Lady. My first raw oysters experience, and during happy hour, they are only $1 each! I was scared I would gag! The raw oysters are not gross but not that special to me. I also drank 2 $6 drafts of Big Wave Golden Ale from Hawaii. For someone who does not care for the taste alcohol, that was a smooth, fruity ale with no bitterness. I ordered the fish tacos, but would not order them again as they were meh.

text.text: It is also called the Grey Lady. My first raw oysters experience, and during happy hour, they are only $1 each! I was scared I would gag! originalText.text: The Grey Lady shows when you look up restaurant photos. This place is OYSTER BAR, only the letters for ER illuminated outside. The door is glass with a disguised handle. Difficultly level 8 to access the building. Rife with confusion. It was raining hard October 29th, I wanted raw oysters. Ice spice on the radio in the Uber. I was to get married in 2 days. I ordered 80 marine mollusks from the jump for my party of 4. Then I ordered 50 more. The waitress was in disbelief, then I ordered 3 cheesy crab artichoke dips and 4 baskets of fries. It was $1 oyster happy hour. Happy hour on a Sunday? Yes. Wow. I saved $260 because they were 1 a piece instead of 3. It was a Halloween weekend wedding miracle. Now I have more coinage to swaddle my husband in goretex. I ended up contracting bronchitis to no fault of ya’ll which I’m still suffering from but huge dreams were accomplished that day which I can’t mention here. Reference 29th St Tavern Baltimore review for more background on how gifted I am at finding oyster deals.

originalText.text:
The oysters are good, but the price isn't. There's not a lot going for this place that would salvage it from mediocrity or would make it worth the bang for the buck. A really annoying bouncer who had to be haggled with for me to bring in a water bottle (?? it's not a club!), extremely loud music on repeat (literally, the same track on repeat, maddening), staff constantly moving around chairs and tables.
The oysters were great, though, and served quickly. I wouldn't come here again. Terrible atmosphere.
